title: People say they want old GD back because they "miss the drama".
body:
Meanwhile, I'm just sitting here eating popcorn watching them throw temper tantrums about it as they rant on oblivious to the fact there IS entertaining drama on the boards now:

Them.

replies.body: I *kind of* want the old GD back, but only because all these people who don't know how to make a constructive post would go far away from this board.

> people who don't know how to make a constructive post

The truth is, this is a skill. One that we weren't teaching very well in the old forums. If you want to be part of this community, then we want to help you get there. That's definitely a goal on the moderation side. We know there's a learning curve, but the players who try to change their posting habits for the Boards will have a lot of help getting there. It's the one's that don't want to change that we want to go somewhere else. Having a better community starts here guys. If we can create an active non-toxic community in the Boards, it will have positive effects on the entire community. :)

> 
> 
 If you want to be part of this community, then we want to help you get there. 

I want to be apart of the community. I'm sure a lot of people do, but turning this into reddit where only the really popular ideas seem so surface isn't the way to bring the community together. I feel that MAKING people change to this board will only focus people to bicker on what is better, GD vs These boards. Nothing will be talked about or progressed for a while due to this change. Seems very counter intuitive. Before, we had the chance to take our place and think, and your place to think. 

 



> It's the one's that don't want to change that we want to go somewhere else. Having a better community starts here guys. 

This statement seems so absurd. I don't want the board changes, yet I still want this game to progress. Sure gd wasn't perfect.  Neither are these boards. Just because this place is new, sleek, and fancier doesn't mean it's better.  This statement overall makes it seem like you don't want people fighting for what they want. Isn't that the whole point in having forums? Speaking our voice and telling you what we want?   We're telling you we don't want this.

"Isn't that the whole point in having forums? Speaking our voice and telling you what we want?"

If that's the whole point of forums, isn't this format just better? Only popular ideas surface, which means the unpopular ideas don't clog up the system because one or two dudes are persistent.

This allows everyone to only have to deal with actual things people are interested in talking about. Sure, there are problems with it, but even from what you say, it seems to be less than on the old forums.

Democracy is two wolves and a sheep upvoting what they want for dinner. 

Not to mention that Reddit isn't about discourse, it's entirely about karma farming. You make posts for the sole purpose of getting upvotes and not to discuss anything.

And the old GD is what? One sheep repeatedly bumping/creating threads nobody cares about, preventing two wolves from having useful discussions?

That's reddit, this is this. There is no karma here, so nobody can karma farm. 

I would really appreciate it if you would respond in such a way as to be relevant to my point.

I had to go back to this view because latest post didn't allow me to reply. 

Replying to posts is apparently irrelevant for discussion.

I don't know what you're talking about because I haven't changed the viewing options, but it's probably just a bug that will get fixed in time.

What you're saying is still completely irrelevant though.

> If that's the whole point of forums, isn't this format just better? Only popular ideas surface, which means the unpopular ideas don't clog up the system because one or two dudes are persistent.

Ok, so lets say Group A gets on, it's the west coast people, they're all hyped about some new event going on, I.E new skin/champ.
Group B wake up, east coast, they complain about lag on the east coast, no servers, etc. Since They're predominantly up all other threads get sunk behind "East coast servers plz" and an important bug in the other thread goes unnoticed and gets into game becuase the "circle jerk" of east coast severs. 

IE azir

On the older GD all we would need  was a "bump" and the west coast players can go back to the discussion. On the new forums we'd have to find the old thread, and get it back from the downvotes of it not being apart of the "east coast" circle jerk. 

This is just an example, not talking trash about east/west coast.

I never said it was perfect, it certainly can have its flaws. 

However, the situation you talk about only works if A: The bug is never posted in the Bug Reports forum (or any piece of info is never posted where it would be most appreciated) AND B: Very few or no people on the East Coast care about said bug (or the thread its' in).

Which seems a lot less likely than a thread that gets a new post every half hour getting stuck under 5 meme threads, 2 porn threads, and a bunch of circlejerking.

Ok, for example even now, there's a huge circle jerk of people demanding old forums back. Just arguing and bickering.  Mod's are moving threads from board to board. There's no order right now.  Nothing productive is making it way to the top. 

As soon as something large comes up again everything will be buried by the barrage of other unimportant circle jerks.

You claim as soon as something large comes up again it will be buried, but you have no evidence or reasoning to back that up. So why should I believe you? What you say is just as likely as it becoming the #1 thread.

> You claim as soon as something large comes up again it will be buried, but you have no evidence or reasoning to back that up. So why should I believe you? What you say is just as likely as it becoming the #1 thread.

Here is a link where a rioter has been looking for a bug that causes bug splat:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/AFiub1UN-bugsplat-when-ward-hopping-with-kat

Don't you think this type bug should have awareness that could possibly change the outcome of a game, over that of the 3 "hottest" threads being about the shutting down of the old forums?

Could the public help with it(thus making it a good thread to have on the front), quite possibly.

But that is not mine or your job to decide. This system works far more like a democracy than a dictatorship ('you will see this because I deem it so'), and people seem to usually like that kind of style more.

> Could the public help with it(thus making it a good thread to have on the front), quite possibly.
>

I agree, it's all the community choice. All I'm trying to get out of this is, the community is telling riot in overwhelming popularity that it wants it's old forums back. 

Now we have to wait and see if riot responds listing to the community or validating that nothing on the forums will be listened to.

Not listening to one thing != never listens to anything. 

Also, Vocal Minority // Circlejerk is definitely a thing on Reddit-Esque boards. This could easily be either of those, or something else that's irrelevant to how good the new boards are.

ALSO, if your only argument to "These boards are better because they more easily facilitate the discussion the community wants" is 'But right now the community wants to talk about how the old boards were better!" then you've got no logical reason to want to go back.

Except for design issues, all of which are I assume subject to change, and none of which I personally have a problem with, so I can't really talk about those.

> ALSO, if your only argument to "These boards are better because they more easily facilitate the discussion the community wants" is 'But right now the community wants to talk about how the old boards were better!" then you've got no logical reason to want to go back.

Please explain how to run contests when threads poof after a week.

This is easy. Tie it to something outside of these Boards. 

Facebook, Twitch, Twitter, etc...
A very fair point, I'll keep this in mind.

Lmao... Tamat there is no learning curve.  It is very easy to write a constructive post in low level diction designed for a video game community lol.
I believe that there are too many people on these boards for a real 'discussion.'

Maybe people would leave more constructive comments if you actually responded to them. I spent a *lot* of time trying to explain exactly how you were ruining top lane with early game itemization changes and how the dorans/summoner changes were going to make fighters absolute garbage in lane; as well as brainstorming solutions to change melee vs range dynamic so it didn't vary as much with elo. (And I was 100% right while the reds claiming they would deal with it if it became an issue have proven themselves blatant liars. Shocking)

The only real response I got was when I said ghostcrawler balanced games badly with blatant bias so I gave up and mostly just show up now to laugh with people at how the game is being balanced badly with blatant bias. And now you take that away so you can watch verbally fellate you a la reddit while surely offering you brilliant constructive populist balance advice such as "supports should be able to do as much as everyone else on no gold stream and this surely won't make them broken solos" and "adcs are tower taking machines".

And the best way of doing that is shoving an entire community into a small little section like an interment camp if they don't agree with your forums posting style? Really Tamat? 

As of right now if you don't like Leddit, you are stuck posting in GD for: E-sports, Lore, Strategy, Dominion, Twisted treeline, Help and Support, Champion Ideas, Mac, etc etc. You get the picture. 

Ya thats a fantastic way of going about making a non toxic community.
How about teaching and moderating on a forum that *doesn't* consist of muddy dark green on dark blue with unclear edges and no smileys?
The mods will get them, don't you worry.

And then every second post wouldn't be about "OMG Rito thees new boardss suxx!!1!" I'm already yearning for the glory days when GD held the large majority of the complainers and memespammers. Guess I'll just have to sit on "New" and downvote stuff like that to oblivion.
I actually like the board, no more stupid shit post "GDER's" who think they're god or something. Couldn't stand any of them.
Gd was a more cancerous version of /b/. Less than half the shit on there was related to the game
I want the old GD back because it didn't look like shit.

Yes it did. You'd go to the front page and bam, loads of shit everywhere. Circlejerks, weebisms, crybaby ranting, attention whoring, forced memes. It was basically 4chan 2.0 and I for one am glad it is gone. I sure hope these mods are absolute nazis like Riot promised and drive off all the shitposters with mass waves of bans.

Agree 100%, general discussion was just cancerous you'd be looking up a specific champ (Quinn for example) then you'd get that worthless waste of space Quinn Possible posting about random bullshit that no one cares about, glad GD is gone and i'm glad the self adsorbed shit posters are too. Love the GDer downvotes too lel have +1
